newsitem.title: USA: N.H. funeral director stored bodies - report.
newsitem.headline: N.H. funeral director stored bodies - report.

text.p: A New Hampshire funeral director stored corpses for months rather than cremate the bodies because he pocketed the more than $160,000 spent to dispose of the remains, the Boston Herald reported on Wednesday.
Kenneth Sprague, 36, of Plymouth, New Hampshire, pleaded innocent to eight felony charges of taking the money from at least 46 people to pay for their own funerals.
"The more we looked at it, the more calls we kept getting from people wondering where their money went," Plymouth Police Lt. Peter Gardner told the newspaper.
Sprague put off cremating the bodies for up to three months until he had enough money to pay for their cremations, but when the victims complained, the scheme started to fall apart.
If convicted, he faces up to 90 days in prison.
